meanings.definition: Resembling a tag in appearance or function.
meanings.sent1: The small, square sticker on the gift was taglike.
meanings.sent2: The taglike label on the shirt had the price printed on it.
meanings.sent3: The taglike shape of the cloud made it look like a fluffy square.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat and taglike, it almost seemed printed.
meanings.sent5: The taglike symbol on the map indicated the location of the treasure.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics similar to a tag.
meanings.sent1: The dog's collar was taglike, with the owner's contact information.
meanings.sent2: The taglike keychain jingled as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The taglike sound of the wind chime brought a sense of calm.
meanings.sent4: His taglike memory for details impressed his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The taglike shape of the cloud made it look like a fluffy square.

meanings.definition: To attach or label something in a manner similar to a tag.
meanings.sent1: She would taglike the boxes with colorful stickers for easy identification.
meanings.sent2: He taglike the files with different categories for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to taglike each other with funny nicknames.
meanings.sent4: The artist would taglike his paintings with his signature in the corner.
meanings.sent5: Remember to taglike your luggage before boarding the plane.
